intro: Senecio merendonensis, commonly known as the Merendon's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, Senecio merendonensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
